job_title: Ccht in New York, NY
pros: Working at Rogosin Institute Westside is a good experience. I have worked with both well trained nurses and technicians. The facility is new and the overall environment of the clinic is ambient.
cons: The few issues I  have encountered in Rogosin Institute Westside is the management and short number of staff. Turnover at the facility is high and most of the employees are overworked. Furthermore the staff is required to work outside of their assigned job descriptions. These attributes are caused by a lack of a permanent clinical administrator.

job_title: Nursing in New York, NY
pros: There are no pros. The only pro is that this company is so scattered over so many destinations and no one really checks up on you...
cons: The health insurance/benefits are the worst.  There is no incentive to promote.  Lots of old ways and old thinking.  Salaries are not fair market.  If you don't have a job and need one then I guess its a job and a paycheck other than that keep looking.  There are lots of "old timers" that have no idea what is going on in the real working world.  The CEO is never around, his second in command is a bully and the "women" in charge is out for blood all the time.

job_title: Dialysis Nurse RN in New York, NY
pros: Time off is alternate weekends, vacation requests easily obtained if requested in advance.  Excellent benefits.  Staff is friendly and works hard.
cons:
Prime time (holidays, summer vacation) time off requires advance request.  Benefits at a cost.  Accomodating staff requests for time off requires remaining staff to assume multiple assignments.
  Sick calls are often requiring multiple assignments to remaining staff

job_title: Anonymous Employee in New York, NY
